results.title: Rugby Union football
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: A description of the fundamental principles of the game of Rugby Union Football. Filmed at Twickenham with the clubs of Richmond and Rosslyn Park, this is a visual explanation of the laws and the skills of the game in a manner which will be helpful to referees, players and spectators.

constellations_primary.name: Dancing on a dream
constellations_primary.description: Mechanical lantern slides called chromotropes created wondrously complex patterns of light through sliding glass panels and internal gears.

results.title: Rudyard Kipling's How the elephant got his trunk (K)
results.creator_credit: Ed Newmann and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Based on Rudyard Kipling’s classic fable in the “Just So Stories” series, this beautifully presented story in claymation tells of a young elephant who learns the price and reaps the rewards of curiosity. When the elephant asks the crocodile what he has for dinner, the crocodile clamps the elephant’s stubby nose in his teeth. Pulling away, the elephant finds his nose is stretched completely out of shape - but to his surprise he discovers the long trunk is useful in a number of ways.

results.title: Rubens [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Henri Storck, Paul Haesaerts and Ministere de l'Instruction Publique et le Ministere des Communications Belgique
results.brief_description: This film received 1st prize at the 1948 International Film Festival at Venice. It opens with an analysis of Rubens’ style. Comparisons are made with other painters by using a split screen. After this contrasting of styles and compositions, the film introduces actuality shots of clouds, water and flames, superimposed over paintings showing clearly the corresponding fluidity and roundness of Rubens’ general style. The second section of the film deals with Rubens’ life, his family, his travels and his methods of working. Photography by Robert Gudin. Translation and narration by Charles Jarrell.

results.title: Rubens
results.creator_credit: John Cleinge, International Film Bureau Inc and Resobel
results.brief_description: Presents the life and work of Rubens. Through biographical information and a look at a range of his paintings Ruben’s message of personal and artistic freedom is emphasised.

results.title: Rube Goldberg Newsreel
results.brief_description: Rube Goldberg drew animated cartoons for newsreels distributed by the Pathe Company. This rare footage features him working on the animations.

constellations_other.name: 9.5mm Pathe-Baby and parents behaving badly
constellations_other.description: A look at the link between the Pathé-Baby system and animation, as well as the relationship between cinematic parents and their children.

results.title: Rubber in roads
results.creator_credit: Dennis Shand, Maxwell Munden and Film Workshop
results.brief_description: Improvement of road surfaces by the discovery that mixing a small quantity of natural rubber powder with bitumen makes a harder wearing surface. Tests carried out in the laboratories of the British Rubber Producers Research Associations.

results.title: Rubber in building
results.brief_description: Illustrates the many ways in which rubber can be employed in building processes: tyres, conveyor belts and hoses used in contractors equipment; extractable rubber core used in the pre-stressing of concrete beams; sound proofing system of floating floor construction using rubber under floor battens etc.

results.title: RSVP = Retired Senior Volunteer Programme
results.creator_credit: Bob Connolly, Barry Pierce and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The Retired Senior Volunteer Program offers retired people volunteer work with organisations who can use their expertise. This Government funded program is unique in Australia. It gives senior citizens meaningful work in retirement.

results.title: Royal tournament
results.brief_description: The Royal Tournament presented annually by the Armed Forces of Britain at Earls Court, London. Massed bands, gymnastic displays, horse-riding and military manoeuvres are included in the display.
